item.title: 特朗普封堵中国航运漏洞，提高美国消费者价格
item.description: 从周五开始，从中国运往美国的小价值包裹将不再享受关税豁免，届时唐纳德-特朗普总统针对他称之为 "大骗局 "的例外情况的举措将生效。【原文：Small-value packages shipped to the US from China will no longer be exempted from tariffs starting Friday, when President Donald Trump’s move against an exception he called a “big scam” takes effect.】

item.title: 为核能唱赞歌的合唱团日益壮大
item.description:
不久前，人们还认为太阳能发电速度太慢、成本太高、争议太多，无法在未来的能源组合中发挥重要作用。但现在不同了。【原文：

Not long ago, it was seen as too slow, too expensive and too controversial to play a major role in the future energy mix. Not anymore.

】

item.title: 中美关系有望改善，台湾货币和股市大涨
item.description: 由于有迹象表明中美之间的贸易紧张局势可能开始缓和，而且美国科技企业的盈利提振了台湾半导体出口的前景，台湾货币和股市周五大涨。【原文：Taiwan’s currency and stocks surged Friday on signs trade tensions between US and China may start easing and as US tech earnings boosted the outlook of the island’s semiconductor exports.】

item.title: 黄金之路因交易猜测而停止交易
item.description: Gold Road Resources Ltd.的股票在悉尼暂停交易，该矿业公司称 "媒体对潜在的控制权变更交易进行了猜测"。【原文：Gold Road Resources Ltd. shares were suspended from trading in Sydney, with the miner citing “media speculation regarding a potential change of control transaction”.】

item.title: 特朗普关税打击需求，亚洲工厂遭受重创
item.description: 面对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）10%的基准关税，亚洲大部分地区的制造业活动在4月份出现萎缩，企业在需求疲软和暂停新订单的情况下举步维艰。【原文：Manufacturing activity across most of Asia contracted in April, with companies struggling with weaker demand and pausing new orders in the face of US President Donald Trump’s baseline 10% tariff.】

item.title: Pop Mart 持有人出售 9,700 万美元股份，紧接着又出售其他股份
item.description: Pop Mart International Group Ltd.的一位投资者在本周早些时候出售了这家中国玩具公司的股票后不久，又通过出售股票筹集到了 9700 万美元，该公司的粉丝包括 K-pop 乐队 Blackpink 的 Lisa。【原文：An investor in Pop Mart International Group Ltd., whose fans include K-pop band Blackpink’s Lisa, raised $97 million by selling the stock soon after another sale of the Chinese toy company’s shares earlier this week.】

item.title: 印度顶级债券基金称，尽管市场情绪鸽派，但反弹已达顶峰
item.description: 对于印度一位具有历史感的绩优基金经理来说，印度主权债券市场的涨势已进入尾声。【原文：For one of India’s top-performing fund managers with a sense of history, the rally in the nation’s sovereign bond market is in its final stretches.】

item.title: 丰田、任天堂面临关税风险：亚洲财报周前瞻
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）本周签署指令，缓解了投资者对美国关税的最大担忧，丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp.【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. kicks off Japanese automotive earnings on the heels of President Donald Trump signing directives this week that eased the worst investor fears about US tariffs.】

item.title: 中国称正在权衡与美国的贸易谈判，铜价上涨
item.description: 在中国表示正在评估与美国的贸易谈判之后，铜价上涨，这使人们对谈判可能降低这两个最大经济体之间的关税感到乐观。【原文：Copper rose after China said it was evaluating having trade talks with the US, raising optimism that negotiations could reduce tariffs between the two largest economies.】

item.title: 蓝猫旗下的 Stack 寻求 8.33 亿美元贷款以促进亚洲发展
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着亚洲对人工智能和云服务的需求加速增长，蓝猫资本（Blue Owl Capital）旗下的数据中心运营商斯塔克基础设施公司（Stack Infrastructure Inc.【原文：Blue Owl Capital-owned data center operator Stack Infrastructure Inc. is seeking an about A$1.3 billion ($833 million) loan, according to people familiar with the matter, as demand for artificial intelligence and cloud services accelerates in Asia.】

item.title: 印度卢比因外资流入和贸易谈判前景光明而走强
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 检察官可能扩大新加坡 Nvidia 欺诈案的指控范围
item.description: 新加坡检察官又争取到八周时间来深化调查，并有可能对三名男子提出更多指控，这三名男子被控在运送可能含有中国禁用的英伟达公司芯片的服务器时涉嫌欺诈。【原文：Singaporean prosecutors secured eight more weeks to deepen a probe and potentially bring more charges against three men accused of fraud in shipping servers likely containing Nvidia Corp. chips banned from China.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 3 月份零售额连续第三个月攀升
item.description: 澳大利亚零售销售连续第三个月增长，反映出近期消费者支出回升，表明在美国关税引发全球市场波动浪潮之前，澳大利亚经济处于合理状态。【原文：Australian retail sales rose for a third straight month, reflecting a recent pickup in consumer spending and suggesting the economy was in reasonable shape before US tariffs set off a wave of volatility across global markets.】

item.title: 债券交易员在非农数据公布前押注关税引发的就业放缓
item.description: 美国债券投资者纷纷押注唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策将减缓全球最大经济体的发展速度，并迫使美联储降低利率。【原文：US bond investors have been piling into bets that President Donald Trump’s tariffs will slow the world’s largest economy and force the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国共和党计划出售数十亿石油和天然气，帮助支付特朗普的税收法案
item.description: 据彭博新闻社看到的一份文件显示，众议院共和党人计划通过增加美国石油、天然气和煤炭租赁销售以及其他措施来筹集超过 150 亿美元的收入，以帮助支付唐纳德-特朗普总统的大规模减税方案。【原文：House Republicans plan to raise more than $15 billion in revenue through increasing US oil, gas and coal lease sales, as well as other measures, to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive tax cut package, according to a document seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 日本赤泽认为与美国的贸易谈判将在五月份取得进展
item.description: 日本首席贸易谈判代表在华盛顿结束最新一轮会谈后表示，美日之间的贸易谈判可能将在五月中旬获得动力。【原文：Trade discussions between the US and Japan will probably gain momentum in mid-May, Japan’s chief trade negotiator said after concluding the latest round of talks in Washington.】

item.title: 交易员削减美国降息押注，黄金走向周线跌势
item.description: 由于华尔街因科技股盈利强劲而重拾风险偏好，且交易员在工厂活动数据公布后抑制了对美国今年降息的押注，黄金将迎来今年以来首次连续周线下跌。【原文：Gold was set for its first back-to-back weekly loss this year, as risk appetite returned to Wall Street on strong tech earnings and traders curbed their bets on US interest-rate cuts this year after factory activity data.】

item.title: OpenAI 在重组诉讼中无法抵御马斯克的欺诈指控
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）声称，OpenAI 计划转型为营利性企业，从而违背了其作为公共慈善机构运作的承诺。【原文：A judge narrowed the claims that Elon Musk can pursue in his lawsuit alleging that OpenAI broke its promise to function as a public charity by making plans to transform itself into a for-profit business.】

item.title: 中美谈判陷入数周僵局后，中国称正对其进行评估
item.description: 中国表示正在评估与美国进行贸易谈判的可能性，这是自唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上个月加征关税以来双方可能开始谈判的首个迹象。【原文：China said it is assessing the possibility of trade talks with the US, the first sign since Donald Trump hiked tariffs last month that negotiations could begin between the two sides.】

item.title: 新兴市场股市在关税冲击一个月后反弹
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 4 月 2 日发动关税攻势一个月后，一些新兴市场股市重新走强，原因是这些国家没有卷入中美争端，而且各国政府努力与华盛顿达成协议。【原文：A month after President Donald Trump’s April 2 tariff offensive, some emerging market equities have come back stronger as the countries stay clear of the US-China dispute and governments strive to clinch a deal with Washington.】

item.title: S&P称印尼企业现在更能抵御印尼盾的疲软
item.description: 据S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）称，由于债务负担更加可控，货币贬值率有所缓和，印尼公司目前的状况比之前印尼盾疲软时要好。【原文：Indonesian companies are currently in better shape than in previous bouts of rupiah weakness, thanks to a more manageable debt load and a tempered rate of currency depreciation, according to S&P Global Ratings.】

item.title: 日本就业市场持续紧张，支撑工资上涨势头
item.description: 3 月份，日本劳动力市场仍基本保持紧张，为工资上涨提供了动力，但全球贸易战的不确定性继续使前景暗淡。【原文：Japan’s labor market remained largely tight in March, supporting momentum for wage hikes, while uncertainties over the global trade war continue to darken the outlook.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"会议可能同意增加供应前，原油重现跌势
item.description: 由于交易商权衡了欧佩克+可能增加供应、贸易战对需求的风险以及美国对伊朗制裁的新威胁，本周结束时石油价格下跌。【原文：Oil declined at the end of a volatile week as traders weighed a potential supply hike from OPEC+ and the trade war’s risks to demand, against a fresh threat of US sanctions against Iranian flows.】

item.title: 日本加藤称美国国债可能成为谈判筹码
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）在回答日本不轻易出售所持美国国债的立场是否会被视为谈判工具的问题时表示，日本持有的美国国债可能会成为日本与美国进行贸易谈判的一张牌。【原文：Japan’s Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said that the country’s US Treasury holdings could be a card in its trade negotiations with the US, in response to a question asking whether Japan’s stance of not easily selling the holdings could be seen as a negotiation tool.】

item.title: 韩国通胀稳定为韩国央行降息提供空间
item.description: 韩国 4 月份的消费者物价以同样的速度上涨，这为央行在本月晚些时候的政策会议上考虑恢复降息周期提供了空间。【原文：South Korea’s consumer prices rose at the same pace in April, giving the central bank scope to consider resuming the rate-cut cycle at its policy meeting later this month.】

item.title: 阿达尼集团扩建印度大型港口获莫迪祝福
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）将于周五为阿达尼集团（Adani Group）位于喀拉拉邦的大型港口二期工程揭幕，在美国正在进行的贿赂调查中展示对亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）的坚定政治支持。【原文：India Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to flag off the second phase of Adani Group’s mega port in Kerala on Friday, showcasing the solid political support for billionaire Gautam Adani amid an ongoing bribery probe in the US.】

item.title: 美国招聘放缓，关税影响首当其冲
item.description: 美国 4 月份的就业增长可能有所放缓，失业率保持稳定，这表明在贸易政策有可能阻碍招聘决定的时期，劳动力需求健康而温和。【原文：US employment growth probably decelerated in April and the jobless rate held steady, illustrating healthy yet moderating labor demand entering a period when trade policy risks chilling the hiring decisions.】

item.title: 苹果和亚马逊盘后股价下跌，美国期货下跌：市场综述
item.description: 在苹果公司和亚马逊公司业绩不佳之后，美国期货周五在亚洲早盘下跌，使原本刺激股市走高的强劲科技财报黯然失色。【原文：US futures fell in Asia early Friday after Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. underwhelmed, taking the shine off an otherwise strong run of tech earnings that spurred stocks higher.】

item.title: 澳大利亚财报季考验银行股的避风港标签
item.description: 澳大利亚银行股是投资者应对关税引发的波动的相对避风港，随着贷款机构从下周开始公布盈利，银行股面临新的考验。【原文：Australia’s banking shares, a relative haven for investors dealing with tariff-induced volatility, face a fresh test as lenders unveil earnings starting next week.】

item.title: 美国联邦雇员申请失业救济人数在飙升后有所下降
item.description: 在特朗普政府开始解雇各机构工作人员时，联邦雇员新提交的失业救济申请曾出现过短暂的飙升，但在过去五周内，申请人数基本持平。【原文：New applications for unemployment benefits filed by federal employees have been largely flat in the past five weeks after a brief spike when the Trump administration started to fire workers across agencies.】
